name: market for bottom ash, MSWI, municipal solid waste | bottom ash, MSWI, municipal solid waste | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30047/documentation

This is a market activity, representing a treatment mix. In the case of products needing treatment, market mixes are supplied by the activities treating the product in the geography defined by the market, and they supply the activities needing to treat the product, as they have generated it as a by-product in the Undefined processes (present as a negative input in system models). Transport to the treating facility or losses are also accounted in this type of markets, when relevant. This is the market for 'bottom ash, MSWI, municipal solid waste' in the geography of Luxembourg. Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

The activity starts with the input from the treatment processes.

A market for a material for treatment (wastes or recyclables) ends with the provision of treatment, i.e. a mix of treatment providers, to activities that generate the reference product as a waste/by-product.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The disposal mix is country-specific for Luxembourg.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset supplies a disposal mix (technology mix) of 'bottom ash, MSWI, municipal solid waste' to the respective waste producing activities.

exchanges.description: Transportation distance is calculated specific for Luxembourg. Total amount of 'Secondary raw materials; municipal wastes and other wastes' is derived from Eurostat in Million ton-km for the year of 2016. It is then divided by total Thousand tonnes to extract km. The latter one is adjusted to metric ton*km simply dy dividing with 1000. Reference: Eurostat, 2018, Summary of annual road freight transport by type of operation and type of transport (1 000 t, Mio Tkm, Mio Veh-km), Retrieved online at: http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/transport/data/database on 05 of June 2018
